title: Magnetic flux - rectangular loop near long wire

content.question: A rectangular loop is positioned a distance <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> from a long, straight, wire with current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math>. Both the loop and the long, straight wire are in the plane of the page. The dimensions of the rectangular loop are <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> by <math alttext="2 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly represents how the magnetic flux <math alttext="phi sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math> through the loop depends on <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub times I s, and denominator pi, end fraction times the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow><mi>π</mi></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub times I s squared, and denominator pi, end fraction times the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>π</mi></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub times I, and denominator pi, end fraction times the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mi>π</mi></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub times I, and denominator pi s, end fraction times the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub times I s, and denominator pi, end fraction times the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow><mi>π</mi></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
